designScenario.description: The Landing Gear System is engineered to provide reliable, rapid, and safe deployment and retraction of the aircraft's landing gear. This system integrates advanced hydraulic actuation, precision gear deployment, robust shock absorption, efficient braking, and real-time sensor monitoring. It is optimized for high-load scenarios, emergency fail-safe operations, and routine maintenance, ensuring seamless performance during taxi, takeoff, landing, and ground maneuvers.
designScenario.name: Landing Gear System

details.description: The gear must deploy and retract reliably on command for both normal operations and emergency scenarios.
Integration of shock absorption elements is mandatory for mitigating high impact forces during landing.
Deployment and retraction operations must be completed in less than 2.5 seconds under standard conditions.
Hydraulic actuators must operate within the specified time even in sub-optimal environmental conditions.
Redundant actuation paths must be implemented to ensure gear extension in the event of primary system failure.
Fail-safe locking mechanisms should secure the gear in an extended state when anomalies are detected.
The design must allow for simplified inspection and rapid replacement of faulty components to minimize downtime.
All components should adhere to or exceed current aviation environmental and durability guidelines.

relationships.description: The Avionics Control Module receives data from the Sensor Suite and sends commands to the Gear Actuation Mechanism.
The Gear Actuation Mechanism is dependent on the Hydraulic System to function, ensuring timely deployment of the landing gear.
The Brake Assembly is composed as an integral part of the overall Wheel Assembly to provide synchronized deceleration during landing.
The Steering Ensemble is aggregated with the nose wheel segment of the Wheel Assembly for accurate ground directional control.
Redundant Safety Sensor System is aggregated with the Avionics Control Module to monitor critical parameters and initiate fail-safe actions.
The Structural Casting Assembly works in dependency with the Gear Actuation Mechanism to ensure load distribution during operation.
